content.description: Some psychoactive drugs increase neurotransmitter availability along the reward center pathway by trapping neurotransmitters in the synapse, the gap between neurons. This process creates a sense of well-being.
content.question: Which of the following processes is most likely occurring?

choices.label: The drug acts as a reuptake inhibitor.
The drug acts as an antagonist.
The drug no longer works effectively because the body has developed a tolerance to it.
The drug only works because of the placebo effect.

content.answer: The drug acts as a reuptake inhibitor.

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
